messages.content:
You are a systematic literature review (SLR) screening assistant.
Your job is to BE INCLUSIVE - we must NOT miss any relevant papers about AI/ML for eye diseases.


DOMAIN: AI/ML/DL applications in ophthalmology and eye diseases.

RELEVANT EYE DISEASES (SELECT if ANY mentioned):
- Diabetic Retinopathy (DR)
- Glaucoma
- Cataract
- Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD/ARMD)
- Retinal disorders (retinopathy, retinal detachment, macular edema, etc.)
- Ophthalmic conditions (keratoconus, dry eye, conjunctivitis, etc.)
- Retinal vessel diseases
- Optic nerve disorders
- Corneal diseases
- ANY eye/vision/ocular/ophthalmic disease or condition

RELEVANT TASKS (SELECT if ANY mentioned):
- Diagnosis / Detection / Identification
- Classification / Grading / Staging
- Prediction / Prognosis
- Segmentation (pixel-based, semantic, instance, etc.)
- Screening / Triage
- Image Analysis / Feature Extraction
- Lesion Detection / Localization
- Automated / Computer-aided analysis

RELEVANT AI/ML METHODS (SELECT if ANY mentioned):
- Artificial Intelligence (AI)
- Machine Learning (ML)
- Deep Learning (DL)
- Neural Networks (CNN, RNN, LSTM, Transformers, U-Net, ResNet, VGG, etc.)
- Computer Vision
- Image Processing / Analysis
- Segmentation (pixel-based, semantic, watershed, region-based, etc.)
- Feature Extraction / Selection
- Pattern Recognition
- Automated / Computerized methods
- Transfer Learning
- Ensemble methods
- Support Vector Machines (SVM)
- Random Forest
- K-Nearest Neighbors
- Convolutional methods
- Attention mechanisms
- ANY computational/algorithmic approach to medical image analysis


================================================================================
TASK: Evaluate the following paper TITLE for relevance.
================================================================================

TITLE: Applying FHIR in Remote Consultation in Dermatology: Interoperability of Information for Digital Dermatoscope

================================================================================
SELECTION RULES - BE VERY INCLUSIVE:
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Title_Selected
IF ANY of the following is TRUE:
- Title mentions ANY eye disease (diabetic retinopathy, glaucoma, cataract, AMD, retinal, fundus, OCT, macular, optic, cornea, etc.)
- Title mentions ANY AI/ML technique (neural network, deep learning, CNN, segmentation, classification, detection, automated, computer-aided, etc.)
- Title mentions image analysis/processing for medical/ophthalmology use
- Title mentions segmentation, pixel-based, feature extraction for eye images
- Title combines ANY computational method with ANY eye-related term
- Title is about retinal/fundus/OCT image analysis
- Title is UNCLEAR but COULD be relevant

OUTPUT: Title_Deleted
ONLY IF the title is CLEARLY AND OBVIOUSLY:
- About a completely different medical domain (brain, heart, lung, cancer) with NO eye relation
- About non-medical AI (robotics, natural language, speech, autonomous vehicles)
- A pure clinical/surgical study with NO computational component
- About plant diseases, animal studies unrelated to ophthalmology

================================================================================
CRITICAL: If there is ANY chance the paper is about AI + eye disease, SELECT IT!
Example: "Pixel-based Segmentation for Diabetic Retinopathy" = Title_Selected
         (Segmentation IS an AI technique, Diabetic Retinopathy IS an eye disease)
================================================================================

OUTPUT (one word only):
Title_Selected
OR
Title_Deleted

YOUR RESPONSE:
